poem:
Title: Unlocking Curl's Chorus

Curly cipher, afro arcana,
Entering, defeated, into Rumbie's realm.
Secrets in scalps, wavy whispers silent.
She reads the strands, tells their tale;
Tenderness sculpting spiral-sprung resolutions.
Eyes opened; self seen, finally felt.
In every curl's chorus, a power unknotted,
In every reflection, a new narrative noted.

Each strand carries a story,
Under Rumbie's hands, transformed to glory.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Runway strands: how to create catwalk-ready styles for curly and afro-textured hair Rumbie Mutsiwa believes in the transformational power of hair. As a hairdresser specialising in curly, wavy and afro hair, she has seen many defeated-looking clients enter her Sydney salon, Rumbie & Co. When they leave, she says: “Their eyes have been opened and they see themselves and feel good about their hair for the first time.” Her knowledge of curly and afro hair". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
